skill.name: html-structure-validate
skill.description: Validate HTML5 structure and basic syntax. BLOCKING quality gate - stops pipeline if validation fails. Ensures deterministic output quality.
skill.summary: Validate HTML5 structure and basic syntax. BLOCKING quality gate - stops pipeline if validation fail...
skill.author: AbeJitsu

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only SKILL.md. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file operations are present in this skill package. The skill describes how to validate HTML structure using an external Python tool.

content.value_statement: AI-generated HTML often contains structural errors that cause rendering issues. This quality gate validates HTML5 compliance, tag closure, and required elements before the pipeline continues.
actual_capabilities: Checks proper tag closure and nesting
Verifies required meta tags and title
limitations: Does not validate CSS or JavaScript syntax
Does not fix HTML errors automatically

use_cases.title: HTML Quality Gate
use_cases.description: Ensures AI-generated book pages meet HTML structural standards before publishing

use_cases.title: Pipeline Validation
use_cases.description: Validates generated HTML files as part of automated content processing pipelines

use_cases.title: Structural Compliance
use_cases.description: Checks that all pages contain required elements and proper HTML structure

prompt_templates.title: Basic Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the html-structure-validate skill to check 04_page_XX.html for HTML5 compliance and proper structure. Report any errors.

prompt_templates.title: Strict Mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Run html-structure-validate in strict mode on chapter_XX page HTML. Include warnings in the failure criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Batch Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use html-structure-validate to check all generated pages in chapter_XX. Generate individual validation reports for each page.

prompt_templates.title: CI Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Run html-structure-validate as a quality gate. Fail the pipeline if any page fails structure validation. Output results to validation_reports/.

best_practices: Run validation as the first quality gate before semantic analysis
Configure strict mode for production content pipelines
Review validation reports to identify patterns in AI-generated HTML issues
Save validation reports for quality metrics tracking
anti_patterns: Skipping validation and proceeding with malformed HTML
Ignoring warnings that accumulate across multiple pages
Using validation as a replacement for prompt engineering
Proceeding past validation without fixing critical errors

faq.question: Does this skill fix HTML errors?
faq.answer: No. This skill validates and reports errors only. You must fix issues manually or regenerate with improved prompts.

faq.question: What HTML elements are required?
faq.answer: Required: DOCTYPE, html, head, body, title, CSS link, page-container div, and main content area.

faq.question: Can I skip validation?
faq.answer: Yes, but this is a blocking quality gate. Skipping may result in broken or non-compliant HTML in your output.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill reads specified HTML files and generates local JSON reports. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why does validation fail sometimes?
faq.answer: Common causes: missing DOCTYPE, unclosed tags, missing title tag, no CSS link, or empty content areas.

faq.question: How is this different from semantic validation?
faq.answer: Structure validation checks HTML syntax and required elements. Semantic validation checks meaning and context.
